snippet: Standing in the middle of the designer sportswear department at Nordstrom, Lisa Razin ticked off the differences between the department stores in the Southern California bazaar. Bullock's is her place to buy cutting-edge fashion,  while Nordstrom ...
lead_paragraph: Standing in the middle of the designer sportswear department at Nordstrom, Lisa Razin ticked off the differences between the department stores in the Southern California bazaar. Bullock's is her place to buy cutting-edge fashion, while Nordstrom is where she goes for cosmetics and party dresses. Robinsons-May has no clear-cut image at all. And then there is Bloomingdale's, which is about to storm into the Southern California market. "I have no clue about it," said Ms. Razin, 30. "I'm a total West Coast person. I am not sure I need another shopping option. But I do know to know that it's cool."

headline.main: Power Shopping in Los Angelas;Bloomingdale's Pushes Into a Crowd
